description____0___multiline: This course introduces the fundamentals of HTML, covering the structure of web pages and basic markup elements. Students will learn how to create headings, paragraphs, lists, links, images, and forms.
learning_outcomes____0___multiline: By the end of the course, students will be able to build simple web pages using HTML and structure content effectively for web browsers.
course__assessment_method____0___multili: Students will be assessed through practical exercises, a small project, and quizzes to evaluate their understanding of HTML structure.
course__course_availability____0___multi: The course is offered every semester and is open to all students with an interest in web development.
course__course_content____0___multiline: Topics include HTML syntax, document structure, headings, paragraphs, links, images, forms, and tables.
course__prerequisites____0___multiline: No prior programming experience is required.
course__teaching_method____0___multiline: The course is delivered through a combination of lectures, hands-on labs, and guided exercises.

description____0___multiline: This course covers the basics of CSS, enabling students to style and layout web pages. Topics include selectors, properties, colors, fonts, and the box model.
learning_outcomes____0___multiline: Students will be able to style HTML elements, apply layouts, and control the visual presentation of web pages.
course__assessment_method____0___multili: Assessment includes assignments, practical styling exercises, and a mini project to demonstrate CSS skills.
course__bibliography____0___multiline: Suggested resources include 'CSS: The Missing Manual' by David Sawyer McFarland and online CSS references.
course__course_availability____0___multi: Available every semester, suitable for beginners in web design and development.
course__course_content____0___multiline: Key topics: selectors, combinators, properties, colors, typography, box model, margins, padding, and borders.
course__prerequisites____0___multiline: Basic knowledge of HTML is recommended.
course__teaching_method____0___multiline: Instruction combines lectures with lab exercises, where students apply CSS to real web pages.

description____0___multiline: Students are introduced to JavaScript programming for dynamic web content, covering variables, functions, events, and DOM manipulation.
learning_outcomes____0___multiline: Students will be able to write basic scripts to enhance web pages with interactivity and dynamic content.
course__assessment_method____0___multili: Evaluation is through coding exercises, small projects, and quizzes that test understanding of JavaScript fundamentals.
course__bibliography____0___multiline: Resources: 'Eloquent JavaScript' by Marijn Haverbeke and MDN Web Docs for JavaScript reference.

course__prerequisites____0___multiline: Requires familiarity with HTML and basic CSS concepts.
course__teaching_method____0___multiline: Delivered via interactive lectures, coding exercises, and guided projects in a lab environment.
